Father, the Family House-Band.--A Christian father is the house-band of his family, binding them close to the throne of God. Never is his interest in his children to flag. The father who has a family of boys should not leave these restless boys wholly to the care of the mother. This is too heavy a burden for her. He should make himself their companion and friend. He should exert himself to keep them from evil associates. It may be hard for the mother to exercise self-control. If the husband sees that his wife's weakness is endangering the 


                                                  167 

safety of the children, he should take more of the burden upon himself, doing all in his power to lead his boys to God.--RH, July 8, 1902.
